item.title: Jenna add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "I was a Flower of the mountain yes when I put the rose in my hair like the Andalusian girls used or shall I wear a red yes and how he kissed me under the Moorish wall and I thought well as well him as another and then I asked him with my eyes to ask again yes and then he asked me would I yes to say yes my mountain flower and first I put my arms around him yes and drew him down to me so he could feel my breasts all perfume yes and his heart was going like mad and yes I said yes I will Yes." -- James Joyce

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I know that I am a small, weak man, but I have amassed a large library; I dream of dangerous places." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Will Durant
item.description: "A history of civilization shares the presumptuousness of every philosophical enterprise: it offers the ridiculous spectacle of a fragment expounding the whole. Like philosophy, such a venture has no rational excuse, and is at best but a brave stupidity; but let us hope that, like philosophy, it will always lure some rash spirits into its fatal depths." -- Will Durant

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Norbert Wiener
item.description: "The world of the future will be an even more demanding struggle against the limitations of our intelligence, not a comfortable hammock in which we can lie down to be waited upon by our robot slaves." -- Norbert Wiener

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Stories of imagination tend to upset those without one." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Jane Yolen
item.description: "Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood." -- Jane Yolen

item.title: Jenna add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "That is part of the beauty of all literature. You discover that your longings are universal longings, that you're not lonely and isolated from anyone. You belong." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Jenna add a quote by J.G. Ballard
item.description: "I believe in the power of the imagination to remake the world, to release the truth within us, to hold back the night, to transcend death, to charm motorways, to ingratiate ourselves with birds, to enlist the confidences of madmen." -- J.G. Ballard

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Will Durant
item.description: "Civilizations are the generations of the racial soul. As family-rearing, and then writing, bound the generations together, handing down the lore of the dying to the young, so print and commerce and a thousand ways of communication may bind the civilizations together, and preserve for future cultures all that is of value for them in our own. Let us, before we die, gather up our heritage, and offer it to our children." -- Will Durant

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: "I wish I was a woman of about thirty-six dressed in black satin with a string of pearls." -- Daphne du Maurier

item.title: Jenna add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "There is a sort of jealousy which needs very little fire: it is hardly a passion, but a blight bred in the cloudy, damp despondency of uneasy egoism." -- George Eliot

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Chad Harbach
item.description: "Each of us, deep down, believes that the whole world issues from his own precious body, like images projected from a tiny slide onto an earth-sized screen. And then, deeper down, each of us knows heâ€™s wrong." -- Chad Harbach

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "She's got feet like boats, whiskers like an American, and her undies are filthy." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Jenna add a quote by Will Durant
item.description: "There is hardly an absurdity of the past that cannot be found flourishing somewhere in the present. Underneath all civilization, ancient or modern, moved and still moves a sea of magic, superstition and sorcery. Perhaps they will remain when the works of our reason have passed away." -- Will Durant
